name: MeterCircle
classdesc:
JET meter circle

A meter circle displays information graphically in a circular bar, highlighting a specific metric value's progress in relation to its min, max and thresholds. 
<oj-c-meter-circle value='4'></oj-c-meter-circle>

Accessibility

The application is required to set one of the following attributes on the element with meaningful descriptors as the oj-c-meter-circle element does not provide a default descriptor.

  • aria-label
  • aria-labelledby
  • aria-describedby

If the application is using readonly, thresholds or reference lines to provide additional context, they need to include such information for screender readers using either of the following methods:

  • aria-describedby
  • aria-labelledby
  • aria-label
  • datatip

If you are using indicatorColor, applications are responsible for making sure that the color meets the minimum contrast ratio.

Keyboard

Key Action
Enter Submit the current value of the meter circle.
Tab Move focus to next element and submit the current value of the meter circle.
Shift + Tab Move focus to previous element.
End Increase the meter circle's transient value to max value. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.
Home Decrease the meter circle's transient value to zero. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.
UpArrow Increase the meter circle's transient value. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.
DownArrow Decrease the meter circle's transient value. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.
LeftArrow Decrease the meter circle's transient value in left-to-right locales. Increase the meter circle's transient value in right-to-left locales. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.
RightArrow Increase the meter circle's transient value in left-to-right locales. Decrease the meter circle's transient value in right-to-left locales. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.

Touch End User Information

Gesture Action
Drag Value change when readonly is false.

name: max
description: Integer value specifying the maximum value of the meter circle.

name: min
description: Integer value specifying the minimum value of the meter circle.

name: readonly
description: Defines whether the value of the meter circle can be changed by the end user.

name: value
description: The value of the meter circle.

name: step
description: Specifies the increment by which values can be changed by the end user when readonly is false. The step must be a positive value that is smaller than the difference between the min and max.

name: color
description: Specifies the color of the meter circle indicator. Only applies when thresholdDisplay is not set to indicator.

name: indicatorSize
description: Specifies the ratio of relative thickness of the indicator to the plot area.

name: innerRadius
description: Specifies the inner radius, defined by the ratio of the distance from the center of the gauge to the innermost edge of the indicator to plot area. Valid values are ratios from 0 to 1. Depends on the size of the gauge and theme.

name: plotArea
description: Specifies the plot area of the meter circle.

name: angleExtent
description: Specifies the angle extent of a meter circle. Value should be provided in degrees.

name: startAngle
description: Specifies the start angle of the plot area relative to the positive x axis. Value should be provided in degrees.

name: referenceLines
description: Specifies the array of objects defining the reference lines for the meter circle.

name: thresholdDisplay
description: Controls whether the current threshold is displayed on the indicator, in the plot area, or if all the thresholds are displayed in the plot area.

name: thresholds
description: An array of objects defining the thresholds for the meter circle.

name: describedBy
description:
Used to establish a relationship between this component and another element.
A common use is to tie a label, which can be a text in a div or some other HTML element, and the oj-c-meter-circle together for accessibility.
The oj-label element has a label-id, which is used by the described-by attribute to tie the two components together to facilitate correct screen reader behavior.

name: labelledBy
description:
Used to establish a relationship between this component and another element.
A common use is to tie a label, which can be a text in a div or some other HTML element, and the oj-c-meter-circle together for accessibility.
The oj-label element has a label-id, which is used by the labelled-by attribute to tie the two components together to facilitate correct screen reader behavior.

name: size
description: Specifies the size of the meter var.

ojvalues.name: fit
ojvalues.description: Meter Circle that fills available width and height.

name: datatip
description:
The function that returns a custom datatip string for given value of meter circle. The function is called with DatatipContext as context. If datatip is undefined,
meter circle will use the default datatip. If the returned value of the function is null, no datatip is shown.

name: transientValue
description: A read-only property for retrieving the transient value from the meter circle. It is triggered when dragging over the meter circle.

name: setProperty
description: Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component of the change, triggering a corresponding event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

name: getProperty
description: Retrieves the value of a property or a subproperty.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

name: setProperties
description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.

name: centerTemplate
description: The centerTemplate slot is used to specify center content. When the template is executed, the component's binding context is extended with the following properties:

properties.name: innerBounds
properties.description: Object containing (x, y, width, height) of the rectangle inscribed in the center area. The inner bounds are useful for inserting content that is guaranteed to fit within the center area. If the angleExtent isn't 360 then we will provide the clipped square.

properties.name: outerBounds
properties.description: Object containing (x, y, width, height) of the rectangle circumscribing the center area. The outer bounds are useful for creating background for the entire center area when used with a CSS border-radius. If the angleExtent isn't 360 then we will provide the clipped square.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The current value of the meter circle.

name: touchDoc
description:
Gesture Action
Drag Value change when readonly is false.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color of the plot area.

properties.name: rendered
properties.description: Defines if the plot area is to be rendered. The default value is on.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color of the text.

properties.name: fontSize
properties.description: The font size of the text.

properties.name: fontStyle
properties.description: The font style of the text.

properties.name: fontWeight
properties.description: The font weight of the text.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
The color of the reference line.

In addition to standard CSS color values, special enumerated values 'danger', 'warning', and 'success' are also supported. These special values are mapped to corresponding CSS color values based upon the current theme.

ojvalues.name: danger
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a danger condition

ojvalues.name: warning
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a warning condition

ojvalues.name: success
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a success condition

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the reference line.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label for the reference line.

properties.name: style
properties.description: The style of the label for the reference line.

properties.name: accessibleLabel
properties.description: A label for the threshold used for accessibility purposes.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
The color of the threshold.

In addition to standard CSS color values, special enumerated values 'danger', 'warning', and 'success' are also supported. These special values are mapped to corresponding CSS color values based upon the current theme.

ojvalues.name: danger
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a danger condition

ojvalues.name: warning
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a warning condition

ojvalues.name: success
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a success condition

properties.name: max
properties.description: The maximum value of the threshold.

name: DatatipContext
description: Context for datatip function.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The current value of the meter circle.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the bounding rectangle.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the bounding rectangle.

properties.name: x
properties.description: The x position of the bounding rectangle.

properties.name: y
properties.description: The y position of the bounding rectangle.
